title: English Language - Intermediate
description: Challenge your intermediate English grammar and vocabulary

questions.question: Which sentence uses the subjunctive mood correctly?
options: If I was you, I would go
If I were you, I would go
If I am you, I would go
If I will be you, I would go
questions.explanation: The subjunctive mood uses 'were' for all persons in hypothetical situations.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the idiom 'break a leg'?
questions.explanation: 'Break a leg' is an idiom meaning 'good luck', often used in theater.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'She has __ working here for five years.'
questions.explanation: Present perfect continuous uses 'has been' + verb-ing.

questions.question: Which word is spelled correctly?
questions.explanation: Remember the rule: 'i' before 'e' except after 'c' - 'receive'.

questions.question: What type of literary device is used in 'The stars danced in the sky'?
questions.explanation: Personification gives human qualities (dancing) to non-human things (stars).

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She's interested __ learning French.'
questions.explanation: 'Interested in' is the correct prepositional phrase.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'write'?
Which sentence uses parallel structure?
options: She likes reading, writing, and to paint
She likes reading, writing, and painting
She likes to read, writing, and paint
She likes read, write, and painting
questions.explanation: Parallel structure uses the same grammatical form: reading, writing, and painting.

questions.question: What does 'ubiquitous' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Ubiquitous' means present everywhere or very common.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Between you and I, this is difficult
Between you and me, this is difficult
Between yourself and I, this is difficult
Between yourself and myself, this is difficult
questions.explanation: After prepositions like 'between', use object pronouns: 'you and me'.
